acknowledgments.summary: This vulnerability was found during the resolution of a Cisco TAC support case.

notes.text:
A vulnerability in the web UI of Cisco Cloud Web Security could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary SQL queries.

The vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface improperly validates SQL values. An authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability sending malicious requests to the affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to modify values on or return values from the underlying database.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
At the time of publication, this vulnerability affected Cisco Cloud Web Security.

See the Details section in the bug ID(s) at the top of this advisory for the most complete and current information.
notes.title: Vulnerable Products

notes.text: Only products listed in the Vulnerable Products ["#vp"] section of this advisory are known to be affected by this vulnerability.
notes.title: Products Confirmed Not Vulnerable

notes.text: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.
notes.title: Workarounds

notes.text: Cisco has addressed this vulnerability in Cisco Cloud Web Security Service, which is cloud based. No user action is required. Customers can determine the current remediation status or software version by using the Help function in the service GUI.  Customers who need additional information are advised to contact the Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC) or their contracted maintenance providers.
notes.title: Fixed Software

notes.text: To learn about Cisco security vulnerability disclosure policies and publications, see the Security Vulnerability Policy ["http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/psirt/security_vulnerability_policy.html"]. This document also contains instructions for obtaining fixed software and receiving security vulnerability information from Cisco.
notes.title: Vulnerability Policy

notes.text: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
notes.title: Exploitation and Public Announcements

notes.text: This vulnerability was found during the resolution of a Cisco TAC support case.
notes.title: Source

references.summary: Cisco Cloud Web Security SQL Injection Vulnerability

document.title: Cisco Cloud Web Security SQL Injection Vulnerability

remediations.details: Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability.
